1.brief: properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
uncircumcised (i.e. still having the prepuce uncurtailed)

2.brief: dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
properly, chastisement, i.e. (by implication) a halter; figuratively, restraint
the back of the neck (as that on which burdens are bound)
exiled; captured; as noun, exile (abstractly or concretely and collectively); by extension, booty
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
to sell, literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to surrender)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun)
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow

5.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
this place (French ici), i.e. here or hence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

7.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to be at home, i.e. (by implication) to be pleasant (or suitable), i.e. beautiful
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
properly, to be fresh, i.e. full (rosy, (figuratively) cheerful); to announce (glad news)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
